ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six gave teachings to people in vehicles. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not give a teaching to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.5_0: a wagon, a carriage, a cart, a chariot.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.6_0: One should not give a teaching to anyone in a vehicle who is not sick.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.7_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, gives a teaching to someone in a vehicle who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.9.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-sk63:1.11_0: The third rule, the third training rule on fire, is finished.
